paper.title: Optimization in Deductive and Conventional Relational Database Systems
paper.abstract: A deductive relational database system is one which permits new relations to be derived from given relations stored in a conventional relational database system, and from axioms. It has been shown that a query in a deductive relational database system can be transformed, using the axioms, into a query that involves searches only over the relational database. The transformed query results in a set of conjuncts which generally share similar if not identical searches that must be made of the indexes and the tables storing the relations. The purpose of this paper is to describe a “global” optimizing algorithm which accounts for similarities between conjuncts.
